sentence: A number of House members have been identified by planners of the “Stop the Steal” rally as having collaborated with them—either directly or via assigned staffers—including Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, Paul Gosar of Arizona, Lauren Boebert of Colorado, Mo Brooks of Alabama, Andy Biggs of Arizona, and Louie Gohmert of Texas.

title: Madison Cawthorn’s Incitement of Insurrection Should Knock Him Off the Ballot

sentence: Other Republican House members, such as Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, Mo Brooks of Alabama, Paul Gosar of Arizona, and Lauren Boebert of Colorado, face similar accusations, but their state’s election laws present higher hurdles for challenges to their candidate qualifications.
title: Cawthorn Challenge Raises the Question: Who Is an ‘Insurrectionist’?

title: Madison Cawthorn retains high-powered GOP attorney for case seeking to disqualify him as an insurrectionist

sentence: A big part of this play is that Kinzinger, along with neo-conservatives like Rep. Liz Cheney, are battling to regain control over a political party now inundated with more flagrantly corrupt, more flagrantly authoritarian, and more flagrantly incompetent officials like Sen. Josh Hawley and Reps. Madison Cawthorn, Lauren Boebert, and Paul Gosar ascending to prominence.
title: Adam Kinzinger has a lot to say: Donald Trump ‘is the worst president the U.S. ever had’

sentence: On one side you have the Trump/MAGA/tea party wing of the GOP, filled with detestable folks like Reps. Lauren Boebert, Matt Gaetz, Madison Cawthorn, Paul Gosar, and Marjorie Taylor Greene.
title: War in the GOP: Have Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar made one too many mistakes?

sentence: While Republican congressional leaders condemned the invasion, Reps. Paul Gosar and Marjorie Taylor Greene both spoke at a white nationalist conference last month whose organizer favorably compared Russian President Vladimir Putin to Adolf Hitler.

title: GOP Rep. Madison Cawthorn Called President Zelenskyy a ‘Thug’

sentence: Even after the invasion, two Trump allies in the House - Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar - participated in a white nationalist conference at which participants applauded Russia's move on Ukraine and chanted Putin's name.

title: Ukraine War Becomes A Cudgel In Republican Party's Internal Conflict

sentence: Other far-right members could also skip the event: Reps Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar both recently attended an event hosted by a white nationalist where guests broke into a chant of “Putin!

title: Six things to watch for when Ukraine’s president Zelensky addresses Congress

sentence: If the 2022 midterms see a major red wave, even the most extreme MAGA Republicans are likely to be reelected to the U.S. House of Representatives — including Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, Rep. Lauren Boebert of Colorado, Rep. Matt Gaetz of Florida and Rep. Paul Gosar of Arizona.
author: Alex Henderson
title: How Madison Cawthorn may have doomed his reelection campaign

sentence: So we thought it was time to start a list of all the things McCarthy has had to pull a lawmaker aside for: The time Representative Paul Gosar made and disseminated a video depicting him swinging a sword at Joe Biden’s head and decapitating Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (McCarthy told CNN he spoke to Gosar, without condemning Gosar’s behavior) The time Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene called for Nancy Pelosi to be executed for treason, harassed a school-shooting survivor on the street, blamed the California wildfires on Jewish laser beams, and espoused the ideas of QAnon (McCarthy refused to discipline the congresswoman and claimed that, during a private conversation, she “recognized” that she needed to hold herself to a higher standard) The time Greene spoke at a white nationalist conference (McCarthy admitted this was bad but, following a conversation with Greene, declined to hold her accountable, saying, “my conversations with my members are exactly that.”) The time Representative Lauren Boebert made Islamophobic comments about Representative Ilhan Omar (McCarthy obviously refused to condemn her but, rest assured, they had a chat!)
author: Bess Levin
title: Orgies, Beheadings, Jewish Space Lasers: Everything Kevin McCarthy Has Had to “Speak” to Republican Lawmakers About

sentence: It took him a week to speak to Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ), who had tweeted a violent video featuring Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.
author: Emily Singer
title: House Republicans Enraged By Cawthorn’s ‘Orgy’ And 'Cocaine Bump' Claims

sentence: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy, who has come under scrutiny for refusing to criticize the far-right of his party—including former President Donald Trump and Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar—reportedly said he would have a meeting with Cawthorn to talk about his comments.

title: Congress Would Like to Know More About Madison Cawthorn’s ‘Cocaine’ ‘Orgies’ Claim

sentence: Arizona Republican Paul Gosar was also at the America First Political Action Conference (AFPAC) in Florida.

sentence: McCarthy's rebukes came after House Democrats had lambasted him for not doing enough to address behavior from other Republican members, namely Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia and Paul Gosar of Arizona, who both spoke at a gathering of white nationalists last month.

title: McCarthy rebukes Cawthorn over his claims that lawmakers have invited him to orgies and use drugs

sentence: Republicans’ outrage over Cawthorn’s Veep-esque account of congressional indiscretions stands in glaring contrast to their muted response to Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and Paul Gosar (R-AZ) speaking at a white nationalist conference last month.

title: North Carolina Sen. Tillis Backs Cawthorn’s Rival Amid Orgy-Gate

title: The GOP Was Hard to Embarrass. Then Came Madison Cawthorn.

sentence: But the final straw for McCarthy was that Cawthorn dared to impugn the character of a caucus that includes the likes of Paul Gosar, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Lauren Boebert.

title: Kevin McCarthy is to blame for Madison Cawthorn. He deserves the consequences

Marjorie Taylor Greene that equated COVID-19 safety measures with the treatment of Jews during the Holocaust and more recently calling it "appalling" that Greene and Rep. Paul Gosar of Arizona attended an event led by a white nationalist.
